intro: Ludwigia leptocarpa subsp. foliosa, commonly known as the broadleaf Ludwigia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, often branching stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in aquatic or semi-aquatic environments, often found in slow-moving streams and marshy areas. Its foliage is popular in aquascaping due to its attractive, dense growth habit and ability to oxygenate water.
